Obtaining sub-breeds/ coccoon?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Card & Adventure Video Games: Monster Rancher Battlecard Episode II Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Obtaining sub-breeds/ coccoon?
By gryphon39 on Thursday, August 17, 2000 - 08:25 pm:

Well, I finally managed to get the Phoenix card
and won my first sunsequent A class battle- I'm
now the proud owner of a Durahan-Dragon. Is there
way other than winning the A class battles to get
sub-breeds? In the shrine, or maybe winning other
battles? Also, does anyone know how the worm's
coccoon/emerge moves work? Every time that I've
tried to use it I'm told that I don't have enough
sub-breeds, or something like that anyways. Has
anyone succeeded with it yet?
thanks!

By Eagle_Fierce on Thursday, August 17, 2000 - 10:42 pm:

I believe that you must use the "Cocoon" card on a Worm/(insert sub-type here), then use the "Emergence" card on the Worm to get it to turn into a (insert breed here)/Worm. That was my understanding, at least. Although, why you'd want to do this at all is beyond me!

By Tony on Friday, August 18, 2000 - 05:13 am:

You can't get monsters from the shrine, and the only way I have gotten the sub-breeds is thru the A Class battles.

By Trickster on Friday, August 18, 2000 - 10:04 am:

I've also gotten some from some practice battles after winning the Championship cup.

By Tony on Friday, August 18, 2000 - 10:17 am:

Do you remember who it was that you played and got them??

By Eagle_Fierce on Friday, August 18, 2000 - 06:18 pm:

Okay, here's my newest findings on these cards (I needed something to get my mind of of Stolatos...I'll K.O. him some day!). the Worm's "Cocoon" card is used on a Worm main breed only. The "Emergence" card replaces (metamorphasises?)the cocooned Worm breed with a another monster that has a sub-type of Worm. The "Emergence" card is placed over the Worm sub-type species and the Worm turns into that. At least, this is my best guess form what it's told me. If anybody has a Night Flyer or a Soboros, I'd be interested on any testing you'd do.

By Eagle_Fierce on Tuesday, August 22, 2000 - 02:02 pm:

Here's my findings...Every time that I face someone five times or more, the deck switches. Once the deck switches, it's possible to get the sub-type cards. This is my personal opinion based on both mine and my Dad's game data. I just hope that STOLATOS doesn't have a sub-type card! I HATE that guy, despite his earnest demeanor. Anyways, beat them five times or more and you'll see the new deck. Whether the deck they play with dictates the chance of getting a sub-type card, I have no idea, though.

By Eagle_Fierce on Wednesday, August 23, 2000 - 11:15 am:

Battle 3: Nelson's House

Battle 4: B rank Tourney for Dragon

By Eagle_Fierce on Wednesday, August 23, 2000 - 07:07 pm:

Well, it seems that I was mistaken. It's three times, and I'm now unsure if tournaments count. nelson just switched to Dark Lord after I got the Henger card from him. I've battled Nelson at LEAST three times in tounrament, but he switched after I got the Henger card. Granted, it was a practice match (trying to win the Black Henger card), he upgraded his deck to Dark Lord. because of this, I'm going to go back on my last statement (as much as I hate doing things like that), and say that three battles not including tournament will cause the opponent ot change up on you. I apologise for my miscalculations.

By Kurasu Soratobu on Thursday, August 24, 2000 - 09:48 am:

I have a feeling that it might be the actual time-schedule of the game, rather than how many times you've faced someone. A high-level tournament tends to draw a high-level deck, fom what Thomas has seen. He's had a few folk that he hasn't faced but once (AKA Stolatos) in a tourney, and the 1K Wall went to the 10K wall in a later tournament. Plus, I'm positive I saw him fighting Stolatos in a tourney later, and he'd gone frmo 10K wall to _1_K Wall, since Thomas was in a lower tournament.

I have a feeling it's by what tourney you're in, and/or how many points you're presently sporting.
